Let's start with the story of this anime.
This anime about a guy reincarnated to a fantasy world as a slime.
The depth of the world they introduce us to is amazing and I found myself curious to know more about it especially that I like open world games.
However, this series manages to ruin all of these by creating the useless characters I have ever seen.
It all started with the main character who came to this world with a powerful. 
The main character used to be introvert andfrom nowhere he Now has all the skills to communicate with others and lead them. \n
All of us know that need a lot of experience and mistakes to reach this level.\n
and the problem does not stop here.\n
When you watch this anime, you can see all the side characters are ridiculous (unless shizue).\n
Every character loses when fights against him and every girl falls in love with him. \n
It just like the world revolves around the main character.\n
This does not make sense.\n\n
Even of these negatives, I enjoy some scenes of this anime.\n
I like the music and the theme they have used. It carries the feeling of the fantasy world. \n
Also, i like the variety of creatures that live in this world.\n
The animation and the art style also are good.\n\n
Briefly, if you like play games (or watch Isekai anime) and have no interest to know about the characters you may like this anime. \n
Other than this, i recommend you to skip this anime.

(This review contains spoilers)
Personally, i think that this anime is a really good one. Although being from the isekai genre, where the main character is op af or the weakest person with the most op ability and ends up beating everyone. However the main protagonist in this world. Rimuru Tempest, is no exception. Although he is overpowered in that world, he still wants to be friends with everyone, avoiding using his powers against others unless it is really necessary, creating a very interesting setting in the show. [Spoilers] . However, in my opinion, there is a real flaw in this anime where the story arcsafter the orc lord arc are compressed a lot. I personally thought the Orclord arc was a good arc but the following arcs like the one with charybdis, i felt the arc was so rushed. The worst part was that they tried to polish and hide this with fight scenes and dialogue. they also accelerate time in the world in the show by a lot but the fact still remains, a monster that is more powerful than the orclord got beaten in 1 episode. The next arc was was also rather rushed. It was the arc about Rimuru becoming a teacher and teaching a bunch of students. When i first watched the beginning of this arc. i felt a genuine interest in it and its potential. But as i watched the next three episodes which concluded the arc, there was no actual problem that happened and everything went as planned and the students problem with having too much magicules in them was solved in 3 episodes. This left me thinking "wait, that's it?" It was so upsetting that the anime was so good at the start but so rushed at the end. I'm guessing they tried to compress so many arcs into one season which is really unreasonable, considering how much of a reputation it built up in the first part. Honestly, i'm just upset that such a great show with such a great foundation just ruined itself after its hype died down. At the end of this, i feel you should still watch the anime the enjoy to journey of Rimuru, just don't be upset when the later story arcs disappoint you after being drawn in to their world of fantasy.


This is strictly my opinion and it might vary with time,

I think it's the right time to write my review after watching 23 episodes. Everyone got so hyped with this anime. But somehow it's getting down-slope. Maybe somebody's expectation was too high. Now I will write this short review as objective as possible.
Story 9/10: The story is so interesting. There's no other Isekai anime that could attract everybody's attention as big as this. Just thinking it, you got reincarnated to the new world as a SLIME. Train your strength from nil. Build your own nation from nil. Fight against many creatures in the parallel world as many as you can imagine. 
Peoples complained that thestory is utter trash just because of the ending of the main story was so 'huh' and forgetting all the excitement of this anime that has been given before. I understand it, I feel the same either. But, I won't forget all the excitement of this anime. They adapt it well. I say it honestly.


Art 9/10: I've no problem with that. Just good as it should be.


Character 6/10: Our main protagonist is too powerful but interesting. Meanwhile, the other seems... lacks. The Development of the character is good. But, when they reach a point. The point that their story-telling is somehow fulfilled. They serve us another character while we still have attention with the previous one.


Enjoyment 10/10: Watch it and enjoy it! This anime is worth to watch. That's the conclusion.

This series is really up my ally. It's good for those that love Isekai animes with OP character with non dragging conflicts. For starters the skill visualisation at the start of the series really captured me. It really keeps you interested. The story itself has a good flow. They really aren't skipping out on the world building so viewers aren't getting confused on what is actually happening. I started reading the manga adaptation while waiting for the new episodes and I noticed how substantially different the storytelling is compared to the anime. I gotta say the anime has done a better job at retelling theplot making it more fluid. But the tempo of the story drastically changed after the orc lord arc ended in ep18/19. The diplomacy side of the story is removed completely due to the limit of episode. The story flow is still good but a lot of character growths are being scrapped and I had to deduct a point from that. Other than that this is a masterpiece of a isekai anime.
